caption: The Greek section of the louvre has on display many historic statues that are well preserved and beautifully displayed.
Greek history is always exciting, but we all agree that the statues must be where they belong,in Greece!!
all the collections are wonderful, and the sculptures from Greece and ancient Rome are no less.

The Louvre Museum's Department of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Antiquities is one of the most fascinating and rich sections of this iconic museum. Upon entering, I felt like I was walking through the heart of the ancient Mediterranean civilization. This space houses a vast collection of sculptures, ceramics, everyday objects and relics that offer a deep look at Greek, Etruscan and Roman cultures.  What impressed me most was the quality of the pieces, such as the famous "Venus de Milo" and the intricate details of the Roman and Greek statues that seemed to come to life. Additionally, Etruscan objects, which generally receive less attention, are equally fascinating, with their funerary urns and jewelry revealing a mysterious world full of symbolism.  The arrangement of the collections in the room allowed me to fully immerse myself in each civilization, understanding their beliefs, their art and their daily life. The atmosphere is solemn and respectful, inviting reflection while exploring the treasures of the past. Visiting this department was an educational and visually impressive experience, ideal for those interested in ancient history and the evolution of art in the Mediterranean basin.
Ancient Greece, your greatness is eternal in the ages of ages!!!
